author: Special Correspondent
text: Tamil Nadu Food Grains Merchants Association appealed to the CEO Rajesh B. Lakhoni not to check small traders carrying cash for making purchases if they produced a valid ID card. In a representation, president S. P. Jeyapragasam said small traders and the public faced hardships when cash was seized from them, following the code of conduct in the State on announcement of the Assembly election date. Small traders, especially from rural areas, visited cities to make purchases. Since they did not have a bank account, they usually carried cash for their purchases and traders did not accept cheques.
title: “Spare cash carried by small traders”
